On Friday’s edition of Breitbart News Tonight , Senior Editor-at-Large Rebecca Mansour will take your calls and discuss the Democrats’ and news media’s dual hyping of President Donald Trump’s alleged “s***hole” comment as a controversy.

Former Navy SEAL officer and CEO of Blackwater Erik Prince will join the show and discuss his military and private experiences working abroad to illuminate the condition of countries allegedly described as “s***holes” by the president.

Breitbart London Editor Raheem Kassam will also call in to discuss the alleged “s***hole” comment, including his recent description of London “turning into a shithole under Sadiq Khan’s” mayorship during a Sky News interview.

Fiat-Chrysler’s and Toyota’s recent recent decisions to invest in American automobile manufacturing – including new plants in Michigan and Alabama – will be discussed by former Wall Street Journal editor Brett Decker.
Breitbart’s Sonnie Johnson, whose new show Sonnie’s Corner airs Saturdays at 1 p.m. Eastern (10 a.m Pacific) on SiriusXM’s Patriot channel 125, will also join the show.
He is an expert on Asia and the bestselling author of Bowing to Beijing: How Barack Obama Is Hastening America’s Decline and Ushering a Century of Chinese Domination.
Breitbart News Tonight broadcasts live on SiriusXM Patriot Channel 125 from 9:00 p.m. to Midnight Eastern (6-9:00 p.m. Pacific).
Listeners will also receive the latest updates on ongoing political amnesty negotiations from Breitbart’s John Binder.
Follow Breitbart News and Rebecca Mansour on Twitter for live updates during the show.
Listeners are encouraged to call into the show at: 1-866-957-2874.
